item.title: OS Customization Is for You
item.description: I got a new, modern laptop recently. This time around, I moved back to linux from OSX. Containerized workloads in particular for me have been annoying on OSX for a while. Linux is a nicer OS if you are spending a lot of your time writing and building code. Everywhere I’ve worked, there’s always one application that has a large enough codebase to cause filesystem slowness to become frustrating. Most of my time on computers is spent between a terminal and a browser, so I don’t have a particularly complex workflow.
